abstract: Louisiana Gov Bobby Jindal announces his candidacy for 2016 Republican presidential nomination, calling himself a 'doer' in sea of 'talkers'; even supporters of Jindal, whose popularity has fallen amid state budgetary woes, admit his candidacy is long shot.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Bobby Jindal, who became Louisiana’s first nonwhite governor since Reconstruction but whose popularity has plummeted, joins a crowded field of Republican contenders.

headline.main: Bobby Jindal Enters Presidential Race, Saying ‘It Is Time for a Doer’
headline.print_headline: Saying ‘It Is Time for a Doer,’ Jindal Enters Race

snippet: Gov. Bobby Jindal, who became Louisiana’s first nonwhite governor since Reconstruction but whose popularity has plummeted, joins a crowded field of Republican contenders.
